ETYMOLOGY: From Old English hwīl 'period of time, space of time', from Proto-Germanic *hwīlō. Related to German Weile.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: conjunction: a word used to connect clauses or sentences or to coordinate words in the same clause.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: During the time that something else is happening; at the same time as.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: While I was waiting, I read a book.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 我等待的时候，读了一本书。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: conjunction: a word used to connect clauses or sentences or to coordinate words in the same clause.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Used to contrast two different facts or ideas; whereas.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Some people enjoy city life, while others prefer the countryside.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 有些人喜欢城市生活，而另一些人则喜欢乡村。

MEANINGS.PATTERN: a while | for a while | in a while
MEANINGS.POS_TIP: noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A period of time, often a short one.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: We haven't seen each other for a while.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 我们有一段时间没见面了。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: transitive verb: a verb that takes one or more objects.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To spend time in a leisurely and often unproductive way, especially to make it pass more quickly or pleasantly.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 消磨时间（尤指愉快或轻松地）
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: They whiled away the afternoon playing board games.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他们打棋盘游戏消磨了一个下午。

REGISTER: Neutral, common in everyday speech and writing.
